Package Model

Interface IBattleModel

All Known Implementing Classes:
Battle
public interface IBattleModel
Interface IBattleModel defines methods required for Battle Model classes.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    ArrayList<String>
    battleStart()
    Method battleStart() initializes the battle by setting User and Enemy players
    int
    getDifficulty()
    Method getDifficulty() returns the difficulty setting for the Battle Game
    IPlayer
    getEnemy()
    Method getEnemy() returns the IPlayer object controlled by computer to combat the user.
    ArrayList<IPlayer>
    getMovePriority()
    Method getMovePriority() returns an ordered ArrayList of Players that dictates which Player's battling Pokemon attacks first and second
    IPlayer
    getUser()
    Method getPlayer() returns the IPlayer object controlled by the user
    IPlayer
    getWinner()
    Method getWinner() returns the IPlayer that won the battle.
    boolean
    isGameOver()
    Method isGameOver() determines if the battle is over and has been won, which happens when one IPlayer's party has all fainted.
    ArrayList<String>
    performAction(IPlayer actor, IPlayer enemy, Skill action)
    Method performAction() has the IPlayer p battling Pokemon perform an attacking skill.

  • Method Details

    • getUser

      IPlayer getUser()
      Method getPlayer() returns the IPlayer object controlled by the user
      Returns:
      IPlayer: object controlled by the user

    • getEnemy

      IPlayer getEnemy()
      Method getEnemy() returns the IPlayer object controlled by computer to combat the user.
      Returns:
      IPlayer: object controlled by the computer

    • getDifficulty

      int getDifficulty()
      Method getDifficulty() returns the difficulty setting for the Battle Game
      Returns:
      int: Difficulty level

    • battleStart

      ArrayList<String> battleStart()
      Method battleStart() initializes the battle by setting User and Enemy players
      Returns:
      ArrayList: Strings representing actions that occur during startup

    • getMovePriority

      ArrayList<IPlayer> getMovePriority() throws IllegalStateException
      Method getMovePriority() returns an ordered ArrayList of Players that dictates which Player's battling Pokemon attacks first and second
      Returns:
      ArrayList: order list of which IPlayer goes first then second
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when isGameOver() == true

    • performAction

      ArrayList<String> performAction(IPlayer actor, IPlayer enemy, Skill action) throws IllegalStateException
      Method performAction() has the IPlayer p battling Pokemon perform an attacking skill. Return string list that captures the events that occur due to the attack
      Parameters:
      actor - IPlayer: player whose Pookemon is to perform an attack
      enemy - IPlayer: player whose Pokemon is to be attacked
      action - Skill: attack skill to perform
      Returns:
      ArrayList: Responses as a result of the action being performed
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when isGameOver() == true

    • isGameOver

      boolean isGameOver()
      Method isGameOver() determines if the battle is over and has been won, which happens when one IPlayer's party has all fainted.
      Returns:
      Boolean: true if a IPlayer has been eliminated, false if not

    • getWinner

      IPlayer getWinner() throws IllegalStateException
      Method getWinner() returns the IPlayer that won the battle.
      Returns:
      IPlayer: IPlayer that won the battle
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when isGameOver() == false
